xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The parser that was generated for the CR-xquery-31-20141218 grammar.
The index of the parser state for accessing the combined (i.e. level > 1) lookahead code.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the begin of the token that has been shifted.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the end of the token that has been shifted.
The index of the parser state for accessing the code of the level-1-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the begin of the level-1-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the end of the level-1-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the code of the level-2-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the begin of the level-2-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the end of the level-2-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the code of the level-3-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the begin of the level-3-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the position in the input string of the end of the level-3-lookahead token.
The index of the parser state for accessing the token code that was expected when an error was found.
The index of the parser state that points to the first entry used for collecting action results.
The codepoint to charclass mapping for 7 bit codepoints.
The codepoint to charclass mapping for codepoints below the surrogate block.
The codepoint to charclass mapping for codepoints above the surrogate block.
Match next token in input string, starting at given index, using the DFA entry state for the set of tokens that are expected in the current context.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $begin the index where to start in input string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: a sequence of three: the token code of the result token, with input string begin and end positions. If there is no valid token, return the negative id of the DFA state that failed, along with begin and end positions of the longest viable prefix.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: p:match
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function p:match($input as xs:string, $begin as xs:integer, $token-set as xs:integer) as xs:integer+

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The DFA state transition function. If we are in a valid DFA state, save it's result annotation, consume one input codepoint, calculate the next state, and use tail recursion to do the same again. Otherwise, return any valid result or a negative DFA state id in case of an error.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $begin the begin index of the current token in the input string.
$current the index of the current position in the input string.
$end the end index of the result in the input string.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: a sequence of three: the token code of the result token, with input string begin and end positions. If there is no valid token, return the negative id of the DFA state that failed, along with begin and end positions of the longest viable prefix.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: p:transition
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function p:transition($input as xs:string, $begin as xs:integer, $current as xs:integer, $end as xs:integer, $result as xs:integer, $current-state as xs:integer, $previous-state as xs:integer) as xs:integer+

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Recursively translate one 32-bit chunk of an expected token bitset to the corresponding sequence of token strings.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $result the result of previous recursion levels.
$chunk the 32-bit chunk of the expected token bitset.
$base-token-code the token code of bit 0 in the current chunk.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: p:token
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function p:token($result as xs:string*, $chunk as xs:integer, $base-token-code as xs:integer) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Calculate expected token set for a given DFA state as a sequence of strings.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: p:expected-token-set
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function p:expected-token-set($state as xs:integer) as xs:string*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Classify codepoint by doing a tail recursive binary search for a matching codepoint range entry in MAP2, the codepoint to charclass map for codepoints above the surrogate block.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $lo the binary search lower bound map index.
$hi the binary search upper bound map index.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Shift one token, i.e. compare lookahead token 1 with expected token and in case of a match, shift lookahead tokens down such that l1 becomes the current token, and higher lookahead tokens move down. When lookahead token 1 does not match the expected token, raise an error by saving the expected token code in the error field of the parser state.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: p:shift
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function p:shift($code as xs:integer, $input as xs:string, $state as item()+) as item()+

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Shift one token, i.e. compare lookahead token 1 with expected token and in case of a match, shift lookahead tokens down such that l1 becomes the current token, and higher lookahead tokens move down. When lookahead token 1 does not match the expected token, raise an error by saving the expected token code in the error field of the parser state. In contrast to p:shift, do not create any output.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Reduce the result stack, creating a nonterminal element. Pop $count elements off the stack, wrap them in a new element named $name, and push the new element.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name the name of the result node.
$begin the input index where the nonterminal begins.
$end the input index where the nonterminal ends.
